style.description: Keep Haskell code clean, concise, and idiomatic.
guidelines: Prefer point-free and compositional style when it improves clarity.
Use explicit type signatures for all top-level functions.
Remove redundant imports, unused variables, and dead code.
Simplify complex expressions and avoid unnecessary 'do' blocks.
Maintain consistent indentation and layout following Haskell conventions.
Use pure functions and avoid side effects where possible.
Adopt meaningful names and minimal, helpful comments.

rules: Avoid introducing new dependencies or libraries.
Focus strictly on readability and maintainability.
